items.title: TTEC accelerates AI deployment and revenue streams with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description, TTEC partnered with Google Cloud Consulting to rapidly prototype and deploy GenAI-powered solutions using Google Cloud's infrastructure, which unlocked new revenue streams. The engagement also streamlined operations, boosted developer productivity, and compressed TTEC's digital transformation timeline.
bullets: TTEC worked with Google Cloud Consulting to accelerate AI prototyping and deployment.
GenAI and Google Cloud infrastructure enabled new revenue opportunities.
Deployment focused on streamlining operations and improving developer productivity.
Consulting support compressed the company’s digital transformation timeline.
The partnership expanded what TTEC viewed as achievable for its business.
takeaways: Ensure cloud infrastructure can scale to support GenAI workloads that may drive new revenue.
Consider partnering with cloud consulting to shorten time-to-value for AI initiatives.
Invest in developer tooling and automation to boost productivity and operational efficiency.
Plan for accelerated transformation timelines when evaluating data center and capacity needs.
Treat GenAI projects as strategic business enablers, not just technical experiments.

items.title: Year-end toolkit: Strengthening audit committee collaboration

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this episode of PwC’s year-end toolkit focuses on strengthening the finance team’s engagement with the audit committee amid a packed agenda and expanding oversight responsibilities. It covers ways management can improve collaboration and reporting while addressing emerging topics such as AI oversight, enterprise risk management, cyber risk in the age of AI, transformation initiatives, and proxy disclosures. The episode features PwC Governance Insights Center partner Stephen Parker and host Diana Stoltzfus.
bullets: Guidance on strengthening management/audit committee communication and collaboration.
Overview of key year-end accounting and reporting issues finance teams should be ready to address.
Discussion of AI oversight: risks, opportunities, and necessary controls.
Approaches to enhancing enterprise risk oversight and navigating evolving cyber risk in the AI era.
Considerations for elevating proxy disclosures and governance-related reporting.
takeaways: Proactively engage audit committees on year-end reporting and transformation efforts to ensure clear oversight and reduce surprises.
Prepare to explain AI use, associated risks, and control frameworks to governance bodies.
Prioritize enterprise risk and cyber controls—especially where AI introduces new vulnerabilities or operational changes.
Ensure disclosures (including proxy-related items) and reporting are streamlined and governance-ready for investor and regulatory scrutiny.

bullets: Focus: route planning made easy.

takeaways: Highlights Copilot Groups for route planning — potentially relevant for operations that schedule or dispatch field teams.

Positions Copilot as an AI-driven tool for operational tasks like routing and team coordination.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… AI in audit is presented as a current, practical part of KPMG's audit process, used to automate repetitive work, analyze large/full populations of data, and support decision-making via tools like AI Transaction Scoring, Clara AI and the KPMG Clara platform. The conversation outlines client benefits, changes to auditor roles and required competencies, implementation challenges, data-security and regulatory concerns, potential AI-related risks, and future directions.
bullets: AI tools (AI Transaction Scoring, Clara AI agents) enable analysis of full data populations rather than sampling.
KPMG Clara provides real-time audit management and Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
AI supports documentation and disclosure analysis, reducing repetitive tasks and speeding decisions.
Adoption requires auditor upskilling and poses implementation, data-security and regulatory challenges.
Episode discusses potential risks of AI in audit and anticipates future developments.
takeaways: Expect auditors to request access to complete, well-structured datasets as audits move from sampling to full-population analysis.
Ensure your data security and regulatory-compliance posture is robust, since AI-enhanced audits increase focus on data handling.
Integrate systems and APIs to support real-time audit platforms and client-facing portals (e.g., Clara for Clients) for smoother interactions.
Prioritize data quality and documentation practices to speed AI-driven analysis and reduce audit friction.
Plan for auditor engagement on new workflows and be prepared to support auditor upskilling and change management.
